intro: Craterispermum puffianum, commonly known as the Puffian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant often grows in rocky or gravelly soils. Craterispermum puffianum is adapted to arid environments and is typically found in coastal or mountainous regions.
